thread.title: Northwestern's JD Haaf carries Tigers into Colonial League soccer final
thread.title_full: Northwestern's JD Haaf carries Tigers into Colonial League soccer final

title: Northwestern's JD Haaf carries Tigers into Colonial League soccer final
text:
Northwestern boys soccer team had plenty of chances in the first half but couldn't get a shot past Salisbury goalkeeper Tyler Keller in the first 30 minutes of their Colonial League semifinal on Tuesday night. 
That was until Tigers senior forward JD Haaf decided to take over the game. 
He scored the game's only two goals in final 10 minutes of the first half to secure the Tigers a spot in Thursday night's Colonial League championship game. 
"Obviously it was a major swing, a momentum changer, if you will, in the game," Northwestern coach Nate Hunsicker said. "Two awesome strikes. Definitely not easy shots by JD. Gave us the lead we needed and took care of the rest going into the second half." JD Haaf (Josh Folck | For lehighvalleylive.com ) 
The second goal came with 21 seconds left in the half and was an impressive individual effort by Haaf, who made a move past a defender, dribbled down the sideline and found the back of the net to give the Tigers all the momentum going into intermission. 
"I got the ball out wide. There was one person in front of me and I started to take him on, beat him and put it in the back of the net," Haaf said. 
It was another highlight for Haaf, who has had plenty this season. 
"He's had an awesome year," Hunsicker said. "All-state quality year. He's definitely been carrying us offensively. He's just a great player, a strong player, physical player, quick speed. Definitely the best striker in the Colonial League, if not the area." 
The Tigers play Moravian Academy on Thursday night with Colonial League gold on the line. Haaf hopes it's a repeat from two years ago when Northwestern won the league championship. 
"It was a great feeling. That was my sophomore year," Haaf said. "So we're looking for that again and hopefully we can do it."
